title: Postal codes in Canada
summary: A Canadian postal code is a six-character string that forms part of a postal address in Canada.[1] Like British, Irish and Dutch postcodes, Canada's postal codes are alphanumeric. They are in the format A1A 1A1, where A is a letter and 1 is a digit, with a space separating the third and fourth characters. As of October 2019, there were 876,445 postal codes[2] using Forward Sortation Areas from A0A in Newfoundland to Y1A in the Yukon.
